channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ivory Coast Gen Zers run low on patience as 83-year-old president runs for fourth term
item.description: More than three-quarters of the West African country's population is under 35.

item.title: Apple is ‘drastically’ cutting iPhone Air production, report says, after new survey reveals ‘virtually no demand’
item.description: Production of the iPhone Air, starting next month, will be "less than 10% of the volume compared with September."

item.title: Deadly floods in Mexico that killed 76 people trigger a 5-mile oil spill that could ripple through the gulf economy
item.description: The Pantepec River, where the spill occured, supplies water for a number of communities.

item.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella’s pay hits a record $96.5 million—he got a 22% pay rise mirroring the $4 trillion tech giant’s skyrocketing shares
item.description: Satya Nadella’s pay hits its highest since becoming Microsoft CEO, driven by a 23% stock surge in 2025 and shares doubling in three years.

item.title: Walmart is determined to win the Thanksgiving meal value wars with a $40 dinner for 10 people
item.description: The Butterball turkey is at its lowest price since 2019, Walmart U.S. president and CEO John Furner said.

item.title: Beyond Meat shares are up 1,200% over a four-session span
U.S. stock benchmarks moving lower with Tesla and IBM earnings after the bell
The U.S. job market was already wobbly before the government shutdown. Now what?
Economic calendar: Fed talk on radar as inflation and housing updates loom
L'Oreal shares suffering through worst day in more than a year
